meanings.definition: The act of creating a humorous imitation or parody.
meanings.sent1: The spoofery of the comedian made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of clever spoofery of popular films.
meanings.sent3: The spoofery in the play had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her spoofery of the teacher's mannerisms was spot on.
meanings.sent5: The children's book was filled with colorful spoofery and silly characters.

meanings.definition: A deceptive or misleading practice involving imitation or trickery.
meanings.sent1: The spoofery of the con artist fooled many people.
meanings.sent2: The email was a classic example of online spoofery.
meanings.sent3: The spoofery of the magician left the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The political campaign was filled with underhanded spoofery.
meanings.sent5: The spy's use of spoofery helped them gather valuable information.
